intro: Hancea papuana, commonly known as the Papuan hancea, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of white or pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests. Hancea papuana is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
